買一送一.definition: buy one, get one free; two for the price of one

買下.definition: to purchase (sth expensive, e.g. a house); to acquire (a company, a copyright etc)

買了佛冷.definition: (Internet slang) eggcorn for the song lyrics "I love Poland" that became a catchphrase in 2018

買回.definition: to buy back; to redeem; repurchase

買官.definition: to buy an official title; to use wealth to acquire office

買官賣官.definition: buying and selling of official positions

買帳.definition: to acknowledge sb as senior or superior (often in negative); to accept (a version of events); to buy it

買春.definition: to visit a prostitute; (literary) to buy wine or drinks

買櫝還珠.definition: to buy a wooden box and return the pearls inside; to show poor judgment (idiom)

買票.definition: to buy tickets; (Tw) to buy votes (in an election)

買空賣空.definition: to speculate; to play the market; (fig.) to sell hot air; to swindle people by posing as a reputable operator

買笑追歡.definition: lit. to buy smiles to seek happiness; abandon oneself to the pleasures of the flesh (idiom)

買賣.definition: purchase and sale; transaction; shop; store

買賬.definition: variant of 買帳|买帐[mai3 zhang4]

買路財.definition: see 買路錢|买路钱[mai3 lu4 qian2]

買路錢.definition: money extorted by bandits in exchange for safe passage; illegal toll; (old) paper money strewn along the path of a funeral procession

買醉.definition: to get drunk; to drown one's sorrows

買面子.definition: to allow sb to save face; to defer to
